choices: Talk with the doorman some more.
1.content:
Alex was on his way home from work. He walked through the old warehouse district where his office was towards the subway station taking a short cut through a small alley.

Wandering between the dumpers he noticed something on the ground glittering in the little light that reached this place. It looked like a badge on a lanyard. Alex picked it up and looked at it more closely.

Both the plastic lanyard and the badge in a plastic sleeve where golden. Amd on the badge big black letters said ALL ACCESS PASS.

Alex kept walking, examining the badge in his hands from all sides. There was no other writing or markings on it.

He turned a corner and passed by the entrance of one of the "hottest" clubs in town. Despite it being only the early evening, already a hand full of people were waited in a short line up to a doorman, who stood in front of velvet rope.

As Alex passed entrance, the doorman suddenly looked up, turned to open the rope and stared at Alex obviously waiting for him to enter. Surprised Alex looked around expecting someone behind him, but there was no one. The doorman continued the stare and even the other people in like seemed to be looking at him expectingly.

Alex had never been to a night club, especially not this one. It wasn't really his "scene". He was just wearing jeans, a t-shirt and sneakers completely under-dressed compared to the other men waiting in line.

He stepped up to the doorman and showed him the badge. "Is this one of yours?"

The doorman glanced at the pass and shook his head. "Nope. Do you want to come in, sir?"
1.title: The Pass

choices: Make his way over the large dance floor to the bar.
Take a seat at one of the tables.
11.content:
Alexander stepped into the darkness.

When his eyes had adjusted he looked around. But there wasn't much too see. Lights flashing to the rhythm of the musc - which wasn't as loud and bad as he had assumed - didn't allow him to see details.

The dance floor in front of him was empty, despite the queue outside, probably due to the exclusivity and the early hour. He made out some figures lurking around the sides where there were tables and seats and some more people were at a bar at the far end of the hall.

Alexander stood there frozen unsure what to do.
11.title: Enter the club.

114.content:
Alexander slowly made his way around the dance floor. He passed some tables where a few small groups of guests sat, most of them were chatting among each other hardly taking notice of him.

About half way around to the bar he saw a spiral stair case off to the side guarded by a large man in a suit. Alexander glaced up and for the first time noticed the large balcony that spanned at least the whole wall on this side of the hall.

As Alexander looked back down at the guard, the guard had noticed him and had stepped aside, obviously waiting for Alexander to take the stairs.
114.title: Have a look around.

choices: Follow Miss Kira up into the VIP area.
Chat some more with the guard.
1142.content:
"Is this the VIP area?" Alex asked.

"Yes, sir. Would you like to enter?" the guard replied friendly.

"Er, but you don't know me, do you?"

"No, sir. But you do have an All Access Pass."

"But the guy at the door said, this isn't one of your passes."

"No, it isn't. Never seen one like it before."

Just then, the mans attention shifted and he glanced past Alex. Alex turned and saw a tall, beautiful woman approach the both of them. She had dark skin, had an Afro and wore a short, golden shining dress and matching heels.

She smiled at the guard, who nodded and said, "Good evening, Miss Kira. Is there anything I can have sent up for you?"

"No, thank you, Nigel." she replied, "I don't think I'll be long. I'm just meeting Marco here." And with that she strode passed Alex. who stared at her as she masterfully took the narrow staircase with the tall shoes.

"Wow, who was that?" Alex blurted out when the woman went out of view.

"Oh, that was Miss Kira Richardson. She's the girl friend of the owner." the guard answered without hesitation. "So, would you like to go up, too? I'll can have a bottle of champaign sent up for you, if you wish. On the house, of course."
1142.title: Talk with guard.

choices: Alex goes over to Miss Kira.
Alex sits down on his own.
11421.content:
"No champaign, thank you", Alex said and started climbing the stairs.

At the top Alex found a dark area filled with tables and alcoves around the side with purple plush couches. Miss Kira settling down in the alcove in the far corner. Otherwise there was no one else up here.

In that moment a door hidden by shadows opened and a young woman, most likely a waitress, appeared.

She nodded and smiled at you. "Good evening, sir. Welcome to 'The Line'. Take a seat where every you like and I'll be right with you." And with that she hurried off to Miss Kira.
11421.title: Follow Miss Kira up into the VIP area.

choices: He looks for a subway employee to tell about the broken door opener.
12.content:
Alex was a bit shocked and didn't really think it was a good idea, so he smiled friendly, said, "No, thank you." and returned back on his way.

As reached the subway station, he stopped in a corner of the station in order to gather his thoughts. He was about to lean against the wall as he heard a click followed by an buzzing noise. He looked up and saw he was standing in front of a service door marked "Private" whose electric door opener was buzzing in order to let someone in. A green light on a key pad beside the door was glowing green.

Alex just stood there with an open mouth. A few seconds later the door stopped buzzing and light turn to red. Alex sighed with relief and turned to leave, but in that moment the door clicked and started buzzing again.

Alex was confused, but curious at the same time.
12.title: Continue on his way.

choices: Look around or speak with the subway employee.
122.content:
Carefully Alex pulled the door open and peeked inside. Behind the door was a break room with a row of lockers, a second door on the opposite side and a table and some chairs.

A subway employee sat at the table eating a sandwich and reading a newspaper. Alex froze for a moment as the man looked up, but he merely nodded at Alex and then continued reading.

Alex stepped inside and the door fell closed behind him. Alex once again looked to the badge he still was holding in his hand. Slowly Alex seemed to realize what he had there, although his still was puzzled how this was possible. He hung the lanyard around his neck for now and looked around considering what do do.
122.title: He enters the door.

choices: Alex has seen enough. He returns the money to the man and leaves.
Alex wants to see just how far he can go and leaves.
Alex stays to talk with the man some more.
1222.content:
Alex looked at the subway employee and spoke to him.

"Hi! How are you?"

The man looked up for a moment. "Fine, thank you." and then went back to reading.

"Do you mind if I ask you something?"

"No problem. Shoot." He put the newspaper aside.

"Is it ok for me to be here?"

"Sure."

"Why?"

Now the man looked puzzled. "You've got an All Access Pass."

"But you don't know me - or this badge, do you?"

The puzzled expression on the man's face became stronger. "No, I don't.'"

"Ok. Thanks anyway."

"You're welcome". The face of the man relaxed and he returned to his newspaper.

Alex walked around the room a bit and ended up looking at the lockers. They were old, covered with scratches and partially torn off stickers. The first one had a name tag reading "Combs". A small but sturdy looking pad lock kept it closed.

Leisurely Alex rattled at the door and he is almost not surprised as the padlock drops open by itself. Alex carefully removed the padlock and opened the locker.

It contained nothing special. A pair of shoes, some street clothes on a hanger, the usual. There was a money clip on top shelf possibly with a few twenties in it. Alex noticed a photo stuck to the inside of the door showing a couple sitting in a park smiling at the camera. Alex turned back to the subway employee. He was most certainly the guy in the photo.

"This is your locker?"

"Sure is." The man replied with a smile.

"And you don't care anyone could take your money?"

"No. Its normally locked, so don't forget to lock it when you're done."

"But I could take it."

"Of course you could."

This was almost getting creepy, but Alex had to try it out. He picked up the cash and locked the locker.

Openly holding the money, Alex moved towards the exit, while starring at the man at the table.

As Alex reached the door, the man looked up and said "Bye. Nice meeting you."
1222.title: Look around or speak with the subway employee.

choices: Decide the badge was to dangerous to keep.
Chat with the waitress about what to do.
12221.content:
"Here," Alex said handing the money back over to the subway employee, "Keep it."

"Hey, thank you. I can really use that."

And with that Alex rushed out of the room and down to the platforms where he boarded a train just pulling in.

The train was full due to rush hour, but he dropped himself into a seat that some vacated just after he got on. He sat there for a while finally trying to order his thoughts and considering the badge and what happened in that subway service area.

After a while he finally looked up as the train pulled into a station and he realized, that he had got into the wrong train and that he was now downtown. The thought that he didn't really want to go home right now anyway and he was starving, so Alex disembarked and climbed up to street level. He found a small diner where he sat down in a dark corner, had a short look at the menu and then waved over the waitress.

"Hi, I'm Mandy. What can I get you?"

The tall, dark haired woman was about Alex's age and she smiled friendly.

"Have you even seen anything like this?" Alex asked, showing her the badge.

"No, I haven't." she replied, "but it's an All-Access Pass, so that means everything's on the house. So, what would you like? I can recommend the steak and kidney pie."

"Sure, I'll take that. And a beer."

"Coming right up."

While eating Alex considered what do do next. Maybe it would be a good idea to get rid of the badge.
12221.title: He returns the money to the man.

choices: Follow her into the back room.
He's gone too far already. Leave.
122212.content:
Alex finished up the pie, and waved the waitress over.

"Can I get you anything else? A dessert maybe?" she asked.

"Do you have a moment? Would you like to sit down?"

The waitress looked around. Despite being dinner time the place was quite empty. "Looks like I can spare a few minutes." she said sitting down.

"Can I ask you where you live?"

"Sure. Just around the corner in 253 11th Street."

Alex was silent for a moment. And then asked "But you wouldn't tell that any other customer would you?"

"Of course not! That would be insane. Do you now what kind of creeps exists out there?"

"And you don't think I'm one of those creeps?"

"Well, if you want me be to be honest, you are acting a bit strange."

"Yet, you would tell, give or allow me do anything?"

"I guess. You do have an All Access Pass."

Alex's heart was thumping loudly in his chest as he finally asked, "Would you unbutton your blouse for me?"

"I'd rather not. Not here in front of everybody."

For a moment Alex though he went too far, but then he realized something. "What if we go in back?"

"That would be better." The waitress nodded and got up.
122212.title: Chat with the waitress about what to do.

1222121.content:
Mandy lead Alex through a door at the rear of the diner, past the restrooms to a door marked "Private".

The room was quite small, yet contained a desk with a computer and covered with papers on the one side, and several tall stacks of boxes on the other.

She turned around and locked the door behind them.

"The owner's not in, but I have to get back to work, so it would be great of this could go quickly." she said, and started unbuttoning her blouse.

Alex was still a bit in shock, but watched Mandy and had a closer look at her. Although Alex wasn't a short man, Mandy was maybe an inch taller than him, despite wearing sneakers. She hat long black hair tied back into a pony tail and quite pale, almost white skin. She had small piercing in her right nostril and some modest but dark make-up on.

And now that she had opened her blouse you also could see she had a colorful, flowery tattoo on her chest just over her breasts, which were held by a simple black bra with just a little lace along the edges.

"Wow." Alex gasp.
1222121.title: Follow her into the back room.

info.brief_description: Alexander finds an All Access Pass.
info.description:
The plot idea of this story should be obvious from the first chapter.

For now the only rule is:

- No one line entires like "Should he go left or right?" or "Who comes in? His Mother or someone else?"

Thanks.
